campaign.story:
A post-apocalyptic game of melancholy. Is it all a facade or is there truth beneath the new order of existence?
PLAY

 The New World 
The decay started around 2020 and in less than thirty years we lost centuries of growth.  In thirty years time, the world changed as we knew it. Birth rates sank, deaths spiral out of control. Imagine for a moment that everything you take for granted is gone;  your video games, your supermarkets, your electricity, and all but five percent of every person you’ve ever known. One could expect here that the wellbeing of the population is at a profound new low. Add to that the grim reality that their survival relies solely on the use of the animated bodies of their dead loved ones and you begin to realize the bleak and irreparably grim existence the survivors must bear. 
Survivors formed communities, barricading themselves behind the walls of makeshift fortresses. Outside the land is reclaimed by nature. Mankind fell to an apocalypse of harmless and quiet ruin. Not with a bang, but with a whimper.
In the end, the dead that come back to haunt us were of our own creation.

The Great Hecatomb 
The height of death in 2057 is known in Florence as the year of The Great Hecatomb. Bodies laying still on the streets, innumerable corpses littered in droves. The remaining survivors, despite the abundance of resources, were on the verge of starvation. There were no hands to cultivate the fields, to raise the cattle, to do anything.
Fortunately for the people of Florence, a collective of brilliant minds had formed. It was these scientists and innovators, who would later become  known as The Builders, who broke the most egregious of taboos to end the famine by exploiting the most abundant resource. By combining the latest frontier of biology with cutting-edge  patents in precision mechanics and thermohydraulics, the Builders synthesized a procedure capable of reanimating corpses and making them into autonomous working machines. The era of constructs and the Florentine Scientific Empire had begun.

Florence and the Constructs
The arrival of the constructs had a traumatic impact on the psyche of a population that was already teetering on the edge. But the people of Florence had little choice. Without this gift they would perish. Over time the constructs became less human, unnecessary physical features removed to further separate them from humans. Leaving them with the appearance of little more than motorized leather mannequins. Now the Florentines had stopped burying their dead entirely, opting instead to give the corpses to the Citadel as a public resource. In return, the fields were supplied with farming constructs, the streets with autonomous garbage collectors, the construction sites with heavy-lifting mechanical assistants, and eventually even the homes of Florence were equipped with their very own domestic servants. Today, the constructs are the base on which the entire Florentine society rests; they are everywhere, everywhere.
In the twenty year aftermath of The Great Hecatomb, Florence expanded and stabilized as a technocracy. Through the use of these constructs, society has found a new way of living. Human bodies are no longer sacred as they once were. They are simply machines to be used for public good after your death, it’s pieces replaceable, for they do not belong to you in any sacred way. Mutilation and maiming are considered little more than temporary setbacks. Human life, however, has never been more precious. Humanity, a flickering light in the darkness, is fading — and to take a life is inconceivable to even the most hardened criminals. Despite the hopelessness and bleakness, even the most broken individuals understand their responsibility to protect what little remains of humanity. 
Despite the disappearance of electronics and due to the rapid advancements in biomedical technology, virtually any illness or injury can be treated if the patient seeks attention quickly enough. Organs can be grown, and limbs can be transplanted safely. An eighty-year-old within the walls today looks and acts as a fifty-year old would at the turn of the century.

The Codex Scientificus
The people, having found salvation through technology, asked for guidance from their saviors and the scientists delivered yet again.  The Council of the Citadel of Sciences of Florence issued the Codex Scientificus, the principles on which the law of Florence and of all the communities under its influence are still based. Born in a period of immense scarcity, the Codex Scientificus saw it necessary to optimize everything to save humanity. The Codex is divided into three parts: Laws, Calculation Models, and Normative Equations.
The Laws, while few, are binding and unchangeable. Most famous among them is the 2-2064, which ratifies the "direct and immediate ownership  of all non-slaughtered bodies, human or otherwise for use at reconversion into worker constructs for public or private utility with deliberate impediment to their transport punishable at the  discretion of the Analytical Commission of the Citadel of Sciences of Florence".
The calculation Models, studied by the Architects and Builders, are nothing more than a series of modules and questionnaires designed to find an individual’s aptitudes in order to place them within society.
The Normative Equations, as practiced by the Militia, contain the means of practical interpretations of the Law, as well as a guidebook on the theoretical limit of constraints to be placed on the population before creating resistance.

The Militia
Born during the collapse from the Municipal Police Corps of Florence and outliving both the military and police. The Militia represents law and order within the walls of Florence and the neighboring communities it controls. The militia which is composed of law enforcement, investigators, and legal servants are tasked with enforcing the law, settling disputes through use of the Normative Equations, and solving the occasional crime.

The Army
By the early 2070s Florence found relative stability. With the famine now behind it and deaths in a slow but encouraging decline, the attention of the community turned to the tumultuous world beyond the walls. Florentines felt it was time to bring order beyond the walls to ensure the safety of neighboring farms and to restore contact with the rest of the world. For this purpose the Florentine Army was born. Among the Florentine army’s elite stands the magnum opus of the Creators; the Technopowered Division. The brainchild of Nicola Fènnù, the Technopowered Division is a testament to his visionary genius. 

The Scrap
Before the advent of hybrid constructs in the mid 2050’s, the population of Florence had little use for the long-defunct technology of their forebears. As they began the effort to move the broken technology of the old world into a small island just northwest of town, a colossal pile of vehicles, appliances, infrastructure, robotic components, and electronics amassed.
Today it is the paradise of the Technosophists, where they can procure virtually all the components needed for their absurd contraptions, from the coil of a fridge to a quantum annealer — no questions asked. The Technosophists are solitary and often nomadic outsiders but, if they had a capital to speak of, it would certainly be the Great Dump. If you find yourself wandering through its canyons of wreckage and corpses of ancient technology, know that somewhere, somehow, you are being watched.
Outside the Walls
Not much is known about the world beyond the walls of Florence. Truth is subjective and trust across both sides of the wall is hard to come by. The world outside, as just outside the tall walls that envelop the city, Forlorn suburbs from the old world lie in a state of decay. beyond them massive farm fields as far as the eye can see — all tended by boiler-bound constructs. Beyond the farms are no roads or rails, but a land reclaimed by wilderness. Out there, you are alone.
In the dead of night, bands of raiders storm the farms on the outskirts of town. The survivors face a cruel fate of torture and slow dismemberment as the cannibal marauders subject the farmers to a slow and painful death. Wolves, bears, and other predators also haunt the reclaimed wilds, hungrily awaiting their prey. 
Crazed, malfunctioning constructs ambush travelers and shred  them alive, tanning the remains for replacement parts or perhaps to enact some sort of revenge on the human race.
Is this world, as I see it, as the people of Florence see it, the truth? Of course not. We see only a sliver of the ruin, and if you were to witness even half of what is out there you would never want to sleep again.
In a broken world where the dead are machines that do the heavy lifting for us, we are just a cog in the social engine, alive at first and forever once dead. The greatest good is to protect human life, at any cost. Nothing is worth more: not the body's sanctity, nor mental sanity.

In Necrobiotic, you can taste the whole spectrum of emotions, from the deepest horror and the bitterest melancholy to the most moving compassion and the lightest laughter, in a continuous celebration of life and a rediscovery of its fragile uniqueness. The original illustrations will drag you into the alleys of a wounded Florence, among human corpses with tanned leather hides, eternal monuments, and coarse foggy streets.

The original game system is based on deck-building mechanics with a standard deck of playing cards, though Tarot cards can also be used.  Players will always know what they can do alone or together, and the game's mechanics will easily push the player’s roleplay toward the character’s features, highlighting everyone's specialties.

Necrobiotic is a dark celebration of life where survival is paramount.  It features unique and emotional art along with a new card system that will draw your players into our grim future.
WIP Special Edition
Who are you?
Architect: You have an educational background in advanced medicine, but you’ve also learned about the science of the constructs. You have mastered the process of tanning corpses and programming the dead.

Militia: You are responsible for keeping civil order within the laws of Florence.  You may be law enforcement, an investigator, a jurist, or even a prosecutor.  You have a level of authority within the walls of Florence, and have an understanding of the law.

Technosophist: You are part of the Free Technosophical Society. You have learned the rudiments of the Technology of the Ancients, learning to recognize lost technologies such as electronic phones and computers or even hydrocarbon engines.  You are able to reactivate, use, and even modify these devices.

Technophant: You have trained as a recruit from the Technopowered Division of the Florence Army. You are equipped with Technopowered Armor, the most devastating weapon known, and are responsible for keeping Florence safe from outward threats.

Engineer: You belong to the Society of Master Builders.  You have advanced knowledge of precision mechanics, thermohydraulics and steam automated mechanics.  You are an inventor, improviser, and a master of modern technology.
Necrobiotic uses a standard deck of playing cards per player.  You create the player character you form from a deck of cards based on your character’s proficiency in Flesh (Hearts), Steel (diamonds), Steam (clubs), and Gear (spades).

At the start of play you take a breath, drawing a hand of 6 cards in your hand and, during a scene or conflict, you are playing 1 to 2 cards depending on if you are trained in the associated skill or not.

Success is a suit that matches the action is taken or a combination of cards that adds up to 8. Successes will be used to move the narrative forward or counter consequences.

Choosing which cards to play from the hand,  allows the players can decide which actions succeed and how, but every action has consequences!

Consequences are the only tool in the hand of the DM (called Machinist) and they give momentum to the narration, leaving the players in suspense.

Players will be able to modify their decks, adding higher cards, removing lesser cards, and buying more face cards that give special abilities. For a deeper look into the mechanics, take a look at the quickstart link above.
Haeli Lee is an illustrator and animator based in Seoul, Korea. She gets her inspiration from various theatre literature and performances and is especially interested in how light and color works.
My Portfolio
Twitter
Nellie Sorenson is a Baltimore-based multi-disciplinary artist. She spend most of her time on personal passion projects based in, but not limited to, clay, fabric, music and paper as mediums of expression. When not creating she can be found working at her local game store No Land Beyond.
Instagram
Ceramics Instagram 
Adi Slepack (she/her) is a graphic designer & game designer based out of Brooklyn, NY. She is the co-founder of Gather Round Games and also the Marketing Coordinator for the IGDN. Adi loves chocolate-y baked goods, sad cartoons, and making cool things with cool people.

Jessica is an illustrator and creator. On the side, she preps, markets, and sells at conventions. She welcomes raising awareness and openly discussing the landscape of children’s welfare, education, and narratives. She works on her creative work and offers mentorship to artists on her Patreon.  
http://jessicafong.mystrikingly.com
https://www.patreon.com/JessicaFong
Sal is a full-time multi-disciplined audio-visual renaissance artist from Chicago with over 17 years of professional experience. He works on local and international film, game, print, and theater projects. You can find him streaming twice a week on Twitch and support his personal work and mentorship program on Patreon.  Sal's Website - https://www.thedarkcloak.com
http://patreon.com/thedarkcloak
Mitchell works as the marketing director for Helmgast and Black Void Games. He is also the CCO of Penny for a Tale LLC. His interest in the indy ttrpg community started with the first year of Pax Unplugged. Since then he has developed two twitch channels and written for several ttrpgs. He looks forward to you playing this wonderful game!

Samantha earned a degree in religious history where learning Italian was a must. She spent time in Rome and would often go down into the subways to speak with nuns near the Vatican to improve her language skills. She picked up Necrobiotic from Mitchell’s kitchen table, “I can read this you know.” Bam, translator. And remember Non tutte le ciambelle riescono col buco, Not all donuts come out with a hole my friends. Things sound better in Italian.

Andrea, born on Easter long long time ago, from over the seas. believes that writing a bio is very difficult, and he prefers to write down another RPG instead.  Larp organizer, partner of "Stratagemma" (shop), Lover of dogs and cats (in equal measure) He reads RPGs, plays whenever he can. Love the playful culture.

Valerio Amadei was born in Rome, Sunday of Carnival, 1984, and this is already a clear sign of many things to come. Moved with his family to Sardinia before his first birthday, he grows up in a schizoid alternation between Emerald nightlight and pre-nuragic geomancy, that leaves forever on him the love for the sea, for the living granite, for everything that transcends the laws of physics discovered so far, and for roleplaying games. He scribbles since childhood, but it’s only since 2016 that his unripe creatures bear the glorious mark of the ISBN code. 
Penny for a Tale started in early 2019 with the mission to create fun and engaging content for all people interested in the tabletop roleplaying hobby. The company focuses on showcasing new and upcoming roleplaying games and work hard to create engaging actual plays filled with drama. Feel free to look around, join the community, and discover new indie tabletop games!

Our Website
Stretch Goal 1: $20,000 -UNLOCKED!!!
Core Rulebook upgrade!

Stretch Goal 2: $25,000-UNLOCKED!!!
Market of Venice
Microsetting + little adventure + new equipment list
The wind of the Carnival of Venice is blowing beside the train, bringing to Florence merchants of masks and biological arabesques. Two more emissaries are traveling with them: one is an ambassador of La Serenissima. The other is consumed by hunger.
Stretch Goal 3: $30,000-UNLOCKED!!!
Adventure Writer - Emily Earhart - "The Case of the Purloined Constructs" 
An explosion at the wall surrounding Florence is punctuated by a wailing siren. Citizens flee for cover, leaving the militia to investigate the situation. Minutes later, the Citadel of Science is raided and several constructs are stolen. By the time the militia arrives on the scene, the thieves have disappeared through the catacombs below.   Every corpse is precious, the bodies a resource that allows the living to survive. The constructs must be recovered.
Stretch Goal 4: $35,000-UNLOCKED!!!
Adventure Writer - Sarah Davis - Missing Pieces 
The owners of a farm outside the walls of Florence have had multiple occasions of their constructs vanishing in the night without a trace. In their worst imaginations, their constructs are suddenly going rogue but then, each time, the construct has returned and continued their duties as though they never left. The players are hired to discreetly learn what’s going on with their constructs and deal with it if it is worth concern before the farm must make a report at the end of the month. They have their reputation to consider, after all.

Stretch Goal 5: $40,000-UNLOCKED!!!
Adventure Writer - Bridget Jeffries - "Paired"
A pair of upper echelons siblings own a Florentine Lodge. They’ve decided, for their own amusement, to offer a form of depraved entertainment to those who can afford it. They spared no expense in designing this lodge. Individuals pay a lot of Florins to “pair” choice selections of the living and the dead against each other in any manner of their choosing. From gladiatorial fights to intimidate encounters, these siblings offer it all. You wake up along with others. Uncertain of where you are or what is in store for you...
Stretch Goal 6: $45,000-UNLOCKED!!!
Adventure Writer - Noir Enigma - "Adrenaline" 
Players will receive a message offering impressive upgrades and be led to a state-of-the-art underground lab that is developing a way to convert a person’s essence into energy. The upgrades are impressive but the more they are used the more empty the user becomes and it is up to the players to shut down the operation or to control it
Stretch Goal 7: $47,500-UNLOCKED!!!
Adventure Writer - Daniel "Drakoniques" Oleh - "From Helpers to Killers" 
Society is hanging on by a thread. It has been for a while. A thread of preserved corpses and spare parts. Automatons forged from steel and the deceased have made what many people think of as the “end times” more tolerable. But, recently, there have been incidences where the very creations that were meant to be making lives easier seem to have been ending them instead.  The party has been brought together by the Militia after the third murder suspected to have been committed by a domestic construct. This will keep happening if they don’t do something about it. It’s their job to figure out how, why, and put a stop to it.
Stretch Goal 8: 50,000-UNLOCKED!!!
Adventure Writer - Steffie de Vaan - "What Rises must Fall" 
The Cult of the Risen claims that constructs retain their soul after resurrection--meaning the labor the Florentine Scientific Empire relies on are actually coerced sentient beings. The Citadel of Science hires the players to investigate the Cult and debunk their claims. Meanwhile, more and more citizens are illegally butchering their dead to prevent resurrection, threatening the future of the Empire.
Stretch Goal 9: $52,500-UNLOCKED!!!
Adventure Writer - Gehenna Games - "Meet your Maker" 
Meet Your Maker is a sidequest written by the twisted minds behind Gehenna Gaming, masters of tabletop gaming and horror. Most citizens of Florence live their lives within fortified walls, which separates city inhabitants from the chaotic landscape beyond the gates. In Meet Your Maker players get the unfortunate opportunity to explore the wasteland outside the city. The Citadel of Science tasks you to investigate and confirm rumors spreading about a settlement of self-aware constructs and how they are maintaining their existence. Discover anarchistic cults, encounter wild and augmented creatures, and find out what’s really going on out there in the wasteland beyond the walls of Florence in this scenario that can be run in three sessions.
Stretch Goal 10: $55,000 Story Writer - Petter Nallo-UNLOCKED!!!
A short story written by the Kult: Divinity Lost 4th Edition creator!
Stretch Goal 11: $57,500-UNLOCKED!!!
Adventure Writer - Mathew Dawkins
Jump into the slums of Florence in a dark tale as you chase down a body part thief while trying to dodge other criminal elements. 
Stretch Goal 12: $60,000-UNLOCKED!!!
Adventure Writer - Keith Asada -"Sleeping Dogs"
Citizens of Florence are going missing.  Every night, someone’s brother or wife or parent walks into the gaping dark and never returns.  Rumors turn neighbors into strangers and strangers into villains.  They say it’s the butcher with his savory sausages.  They hint that the gravedigger knows more than they let on.  Across the city, near the hallowed halls of the Citadel of Sciences, people claim to hear the muffled howl of dogs that sound eerily too human.

Stretch Goal 13: $62,500
Children of the River-New Archetype
Catholic Church buried herself in her monasteries, turning her back to the world, in 2057, when the Science of the constructs was revealed. But human need for rituals and spirituality can’t be suppressed for too long.
The Sons of the River are mystics who rejected the florentine model, looking back at the harmony with nature and pointing the finger at constructs, the abomination that will drag mankind to ruin.
Some of them are hermits in the woods, many are preachers in the city. A few, they say, perform miracles…

Stretch Goal 14: $65,000
Construct Template
Constructs are machines. Very sophisticated machines, but just machines. They can come with tools, options, complex programming, but they are machines.
Nothing of the dead person still remains not the features, nor the gender, and for sure not memory or consciousness. This is something every student at the first year of tanning can tell.
But sometimes…

Stretch Goal 15: $67,500
Merchant of Venice Adventure
Adventure (3-5 sessions)
Bassanio’s mask has fallen.
Will it be Antonio the one who’ll pay for that?
The Shylock Confraternity is already on his trail and won’t give up his Pound of Flesh.
How much will you be able to find out on what’s behind the curtain of La Serenissima before the footlights turn off?
Hurry up: only you can save the last life of The Merchant of Venice.
Stretch Goal 16: $70,000
Upgraded Cards

We are asking for help in Kickstarting the English translation and distribution of the core rulebook with the English translation.

The core rulebook will be approximately 200 pages of setting, rules, and art that brings you into the world of Necrobiotic.

Along with the core rulebooks, we are hoping to provide more content such as custom cards and adventures for the final product via stretch goals.
We adore local gaming stores. In fact, one of our creators runs and owns a local gaming store in Florence! We have a retail pledge that offers 10 copies of the Core Rule Book at a discounted retailer price. 

By being apart of this pledge, you help us fund additional content that benefits our mutual customers!

We look forward to getting to know you!
We will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter finishes, based on the actual costs incurred to ship your particular pledge and choice of add-ons. We will collect this via GameFound after the campaign ends. 

This is so we can be fair to all our backers, as shipping is rarely one size fits all. We will be shipping from the USA
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Kickstarter is not for pre-orders, but a way of supporting a project in exchange for unique products and bonuses. The crowdfunder format reduces economical risks for the producers, meaning that the more people who supports a project, the better the result is for everyone. Helmgast and Modiphius are experienced game developers and have run multiple successful crowdfunded campaigns in the past.

Despite all the knowledge and experience we have in the field and doing our best to not be too optimistic, sometimes we underestimate the workload for a particular segment of the production, meaning we will need more time than originally estimated. We promise we will be open and frequent in our dialogue with you where this happens. We do however want to outline that we will always put quality over speed in our production.

Albeit we have come far with the production to date and have vast previous experience in the field, there are some further risks and challenges involved that one should be aware of, listed below.

- Production: The products are dependent on work from a few dedicated artists, writers, and producers. If they are out for whatever reason, it may be hard and take quite some time to find a replacement.
- Delivery: The product is delivered to you using a third party distribution service. Distribution services are not without errors. Delays and damage to some of the shipments in a Kickstarter campaign are inevitable. We will do our best to assist you where this occurs. All products are insured for transportation and storage.
- Subcontractors: We are dependent on subcontractors for different items. We use high quality and well-known subcontractors. Nevertheless, there are elements in that chain which are sometimes outside our control and which may cause delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Landing a job with the Company was supposed to be your ticket to the big time. Then something went wrong. Luckily, the doctors and the engineers were able to put you back together again, but they had to replace a few of your squishy bits in the process. But your state-of-the-art augmentations are Company property, which basically means YOU are Company property. And if you want to keep getting the little green pills that keep your body from rejecting your shiny new implants, you'll do EXACTLY as the Company says...
You are an Agent of the Company. Equipped with multiple cybernetic augmentations, you carry out the dirty work that keeps the shareholders happy and the corporate executives in their cushy penthouse apartments. When conventional negotiations, political pressure, and legal threats fail, the Company sends you in to "overcome impediments" by any means necessary. From acquiring valuable intellectual property to triggering a competitor's succession plans prematurely, you've been (re)built to handle any assignment that comes your way.
If you succeed, you get another dose of the medication that keeps you alive. If you fail, the Company will terminate your contract and rip the augmentations out of your body before dumping the leftover meat. That's IF you fail and survive, of course...
Augmented is a rules-lite cyberpunk roleplaying game for 2-7 players,  one of whom plays the role of the "Supervisor" to direct the narrative, frame situations, and control NPCs. 
The game uses a simple action resolution adapted from the game Revenant. Each Agent has at least two cybernetic augmentations that provide them with superhuman abilities. The game has no stats or skills. Actions are resolved by rolling 2d6 against a variable target number. One die is assigned to the player, the other to the Supervisor. If the test succeeds, the player narrates the outcome. If it fails, the Supervisor describes what happens next.
But either the player or the Supervisor can still impact the narrative regardless of the outcome if their die result is higher. This can quickly lead to situations in which an Agent successfully performs a task, but still suffers an unexpected problem. On the other hand, it also means that even when an Agent fails, they can still work closer to their ultimate goal.
With no stats or complex mechanics to track, Augmented can be played with little to no preparation. Although the game is well-suited for one shots and episodic missions, Supervisors can use the optional downtime rules to create an extended campaign.
Augmented was first released as a digital PDF earlier in 2021. Funds raised from this Kickstarter campaign will go toward printing physical copies of the game and shipping them to backers. Additional PDF fulfillments will be handled through itch.io.
Original AUGMENTED PDF Releases

The core Augmented rulebook consists of 36 full color pages, but the print edition of will also incorporate the content from the Augmented Campaign Setting Guide, which will add another 30 pages to the zine-sized book. This special print edition will also be provided in digital format as a Kickstarter exclusive. You won't be able to get the combined edition anywhere else! As an added bonus, the Augmented Campaign Setting Guide section will feature all new artwork.
New Special Edition Cover
New art layout for Augmented Campaign Setting Guide
New art layout for Augmented Campaign Setting Guide
$2000: Augmented Soundtrack
Set the perfect mood for your Augmented session with a soundtrack by Morana's Breath. This soundtrack will feature 10-12 instrumental tracks in MP3 format. Check out Morana's Breath on YouTube or Spotify to hear what the Augmented soundtrack may have in store.
In addition to backing the print version of Augmented, I'm also offering a special bundle tier that includes digital copies of all Last Redoubt Games releases at a discounted rate. The "LRG Bundle" will be delivered through Itch.io and includes the following games: 
The Shadow and the Beast
Revenant
Weirdwood
Hounds of the Tsar
The Drowned Lands
Fascination
The book is already completed, so it will be ready to go to the printer as soon as funds clear. Digital copies will be delivered at the conclusion of the campaign. Physical copies will begin shipping out as soon as they arrive from the printer and backer survey information is collected. I anticipate shipping to begin sometime in August, 2021, provided there are no problems with printing along the way.
US Shipping for Physical Copies via USPS: $5
International Shipping for Physical Copies via USPS: $10
I'm a writer based in Tampa, FL. Most of my published work consists of short stories and novels. My most recent fantasy novel, Blackspire, is available from Owl Hollow Press. In addition to fiction, I release roleplaying games under the Last Redoubt Games label. You can find them on Itch.io and DriveThruRPG.

Digital fulfillment will be handled through Itch.io. As with any book project, there may be some unexpected delays throughout the printing and fulfillment process, but since the product itself is complete, any delays should be minor.

updates.update_content:
Wow! Today ended up being a pretty exciting finish as you all were able to bring this project over the finish line!
First of all, a huge thanks to everyone who backed AUGMENTED over the course of the campaign. It was a long process and there were plenty of times where I wasn't sure if we would make the funding goal, but you managed to make it happen. Thank you so much for believing in the game and making a print version a reality.

With a little less than a week to go, it's not looking like we're going to hit the stretch goal of creating a soundtrack for Augmented.  It still could end up happening at some point in the future, but for the time being, I thought I'd share a music video track from the 2016 Morana's Breath album Cybergothic. The album shares a lot of the same DNA as Augmented because it was inspired by the same short stories that formed the basis of the Houston Enclave setting. 
This song, "The City Soaked in Neon," is the opening track from the album:

A quick Sunday update to fill you in on a little addition that I'm making to the game. Someone asked me last week if Augmented would include some premade characters so people could get into the game even faster without having to spend time making an Agent. I hadn't originally planned to include them, but I thought it was a great idea so today I sat down to make some premade characters!
Here's an example of one of them. This is Agent Patel, who used to be a bodyguard for a corporate executive until an unfortunate accident cost them one of their arms. The Company has installed a cyberarm with an integrated firearm and also wired a targeting computer system directly into their brain.

We're a bit more than halfway done now both in terms of time and funding! Over the last couple of weeks, I've done some appearances to talk a bit about the game so I wanted to share these links here in case you've missed them on social media.
First up is an appearance on the podcast RPGs & Baby Makes 3. It's a fun show hosted by Rob Hessler and Gretchen Hilmers that covers a wide range of gaming topics. I came on to talk a bit about Augmented as well as my previous Kickstarter, Weirdwood. I'll leave the YouTube and podcast links here:

updates.update_userinfo: Sometimes it's a marathon, not a sprint.
updates.update_content:
Thanks to everyone who has backed the game so far! This project has come a long way from the vague idea I had just a few months ago, so it's exciting to see it appeal to other gamers.
We're a few days into the campaign and progress has been a bit slower than I'd hoped for, but somethings that's just the way of things. As you're no doubt aware, a large portion of Kickstarter funding usually occurs during the beginning and the end of a campaign. I'm optimistic that the project will be able to pick up more people along the way and build some momentum going into the final days.

campaign.story:
The Crushing Thunder is a Table Top Role-Playing Game designed for players new to the Genre. It lets players roll lots of dice, feel powerful, and get eaten by elemental dinosaurs. The idea originated as a bet with a friend. Another friend of mine is working on a giant robot battle game which inspired me to make my own. Taking special care to avoid his design, I developed the world and the apocalyptic setting of dinosaurs infused with elemental powers, being summoned back into our time by an Earth elemental. What was once an idea to mess with my friend has become a full-fledged game ready to bring some amazing gameplay to players everywhere!

We have a great deal of content planned, such as Novella's and additional enemies to make the setting much more dangerous! We also hope to bring new and detailed maps of the region!

     The Game is played using our Custom 3d6 Cascade Mechanic! Players roll 
     3d6/2, then 1d6, and take their successes to determine results. Players can re-roll dice that land on 6 on attacks. The re-roll mechanic allows for extra dice use for the weight of use.
     Armor and Weapons are based on a power scale. Armor does not halve 
     damage, it reduces the number of dice rolled for easy calculation.
     Enemies are powerful but balanced, based on the resources the character 
     can acquire.
Our main goal is to develop an in-depth world with creative artwork and brilliant stories with engaging scenarios and characters. Cover art by Pavel Lohvynov.

campaign.story:
Crescent is a Tabletop Roleplaying Game set in an endlessly expanding archipelago. Sail off the maps and explore the mysterious magic of each island in a game where your creativity is as boundless as the ocean.
Crescent is a virtually supported TTRPG, and our goal is to provide an experience that is fun and engaging for players whether they play together in person or online. If our Kickstarter is successful, we will host a website with tools that make navigating the game easier. This website will be free for all users to access the game's core rules and early level content, allowing anyone to hop in and play.
Becoming a backer on Kickstarter will give you access to the complete game including all content and rules, and additional features such as character sheets and GM tools.

The World
 Endless Exploration: A world made up of endless islands, each defined by their own strange and unique magics, with new adventures awaiting over every horizon.
 Creative Freedom: An inclusive and flexible setting that empowers GMs and players alike to create their own characters and stories, and imagine within it.
 Unique Take on Magic and the Supernatural: A low-fantasy game where magic is uncontrolled and mysterious, while the supernatural can be just another part of daily life.
 100 Years to Make Your Mark: A richly detailed and unique world setting with time as a central theme, where all mortals die at one-hundred years of age due to a blight known as the Century Curse.
 Original Races: 9 races (and humans), each with their own lore and niche within the Crescent.
The Game
 A Plethora of Character Options: A classless progression system with 14 Attributes and thousands of Techniques to choose from, that ensures that no two characters are alike on or off the battlefield. Over 3000 Techniques when the game is done.
 Roleplay and Non-Combat Scenarios: Detailed systems for non-combat encounters including exploration, investigations, social challenges, and situational skill trials, as well as tools and incentives that promote roleplay, growth, and engagement with the world.
 Engaging Combat: Tactical combat that encourages wit, creative thinking, and teamwork.
 Built to Support Homebrew: Modular support for homebrew so that GMs can more easily and freely create within the system and setting.
Check out our official Discord server for more news and game updates!
The world is neither round, nor flat, cubic or domelike. It is endless. It is a layered, grand sea that spreads indefinitely in all directions. In the center of that infinite ocean is an archipelago which is known as the Crescent. Like the sea surrounding it, the Crescent is also unending, but only to the north and south, and never in a straight line. Instead, if the Crescent archipelago could be viewed from above, it would likely look like the sliver of an endless moon being cast onto the water through the dots of islands reminiscent of pointillism, encompassed by a completely empty sea.
To the inexperienced sailor, open waters spell death. A magic cast down from the three sibling moons clings to the waves of the ocean and changes them. Massive sea walls, called Shifts, have twisted, capsized, and sunk many merchant ships and pirates alike. Cyclones and tropical storms prove a similar threat through torn sails and broken masts. Yet, not all is danger and foreboding. Sailors have learned to surf smaller Shifts across the sea at great speeds, and astronomers have learned the alignments of the stars before a terrible storm. 
The sea brings life too, through the boundless creatures that live below it. Merchants make fortunes by peddling wares from island to island, and pirates steal riches from them on their return journeys. Adventurers travel all across the Crescent, taking odd jobs wherever they go and spreading their names far and wide.
It is said that no two islands of the Crescent are alike. A unique magic resides on each island, causing such severe effects that even neighboring islands can feel like different worlds. Most have their own climate that has no relation to each other, allowing desert islands to exist next to arctic ones. One island's magic could change the very flow of time, so that a minute on the island feels like a day, while another island's magic could create a volcano that is constantly erupting.
Because every island is so distinct, the Mortals of each often develop cultures around them. People living on an island under the effects of a constant thunderstorm could take to the underground and worship gods of rock and stone that protect them from the evils of lightning. People living on an island floating in the sky may not concern themselves with the politics of the region below them, and become aloof. There are even those that take to the sea and live in cities made of coral and shells, if the water around an island is breathable, whether due to an island's magic or their own abilities. 
Luckily, many of these islands have already been charted and detailed by organizations across the Crescent. Notes for these islands can be found in provided guides (Player's Handbook) as you chart a path across the archipelago, and general rules for the structure of these islands (charts) are given to navigators (GMs).
You can see some example islands here:  Example Islands 
It is an adventurer's dangerous task to traverse this melting pot of wild magic and outstanding culture as they sail from island to island, avoiding dangers of both the sea and the surface. To survive is to learn, and to thrive is to adapt to every stop along the way. Their reality will be called into question, and their determination tested. At some point, even death may take a new meaning as the Crescent extends always before them.

 Crescent does not use classes or character archetypes. When players begin making a character, they are given Attribute Points that can be distributed among Crescent's 14 Attributes. These Attributes work to represent the sort of physique and mentality the character has, and show their growth in power and personality. 
Depending on their Attributes, characters become eligible to learn useful abilities called Techniques. 
Techniques are usually split into two categories: Combat Techniques and Utility Techniques. Combat Techniques grant characters new options in combat or enhance other existing options. Utility Techniques grant characters new options outside of combat or guarantee success in specific circumstances. The choice is up to the players on what balance they want to strike between the two, allowing for characters to excel entirely in one area over the other, or choose to be well-rounded but less specialized instead.
Because there are so many possible Attribute combinations in Crescent, there are an abundance of Techniques to try out—nearly 400 at every level. It's unlikely that any two character's builds will look the same. 
Some Combat Technique Examples:
Some Utility Technique Examples:
It takes a particular sort of person to take to the seas of the Crescent. These adventurers are fueled by ambition or dedicated to a longstanding goal. Many pick up odd skills and bodies of information as their journey continues, and develop habits that help them prepare for any situation they might find themselves in. They are skillful and resourceful, but also still flawed as all Mortals are. Some leave their islands for recognition, to hear their names spoken in the mouths of strangers all across the archipelago. Others leave to become stronger and seek out challenges simply to prove themselves. The roleplay systems of Crescent mediate all of these particularities and place them into tangible and interactable terms.
 Dedications: Dedications serve as driving personal goals for characters throughout their story. As players travel from island to island, they’ll come across stories tailored to progress their Dedication or challenge their desire to see it through. Interacting with these stories can grant them additional experience or other mechanical benefits.
 Areas of Knowledge: Every character has Areas of Knowledge which represent subjects they’ve studied or interacted with enough to build a deep knowledge base of. Areas of Knowledge will grant characters otherwise hidden information along their adventure, and boost their chances of success when they can apply their experience.
 Preparations: Adventurers are often associated with the things that they always do to ready themselves, called Preparations. Whether it's something as harmless as always carrying their lyre for an impromptu song or as nervous as checking every room they walk into for spies, Preparations work as a character’s rule for their interaction with the world.
 Habits: People act differently when stuck in a lie, and those differences are represented by their Habits. Habits define the unconscious activity a character performs when in a situation, from sighing continuously when bored to clenching their fists when nervous. Noticing a character’s Habit can reveal the truth about their inner thoughts.
 Reputation: Very few who travel all across the Crescent manage to do so without garnering a Reputation. Characters can create Good Reputations by defeating evil and helping out the needy, or develop Bad Reputations by harming innocents or challenging popular groups. Once a character has built up enough of a Reputation, it begins to spread far and wide across the sea, and may affect their interactions with new islands.
Each of these systems, and many more, help to make the world of the Crescent feel more alive, and the player characters feel more well-placed within it.
Crescent's combat allows players to blend offensive and defensive tactics, and rewards thoughtful choices and teamwork. Characters gain Action Points at the start of their turns which they can use in a variety of ways, from striking their enemies to aiding their allies. Any Action Points that aren't used on a character's turn can be used for defenses and reactions during the rest of the round. Characters often have the option of burning through their Action Points on their turn to try gaining the upper hand, or saving Action Points to defend against a potential counterattack.
Techniques provide new and interesting ways to approach combat. Usually unwise tactics such as taking on two enemies at once can be made beneficial, while certain niches of play such as demoralizing or exhausting enemies can be empowered with the right techniques. Characters can also use techniques to reflect their physique and personality through the association of their attributes.
A swift character may utilize their speed to charge into combat for a powerful strike before nimbly escaping. A knowledgeable character may gauge an enemy’s weaknesses and attempt to exploit them. 
A character's choice of weapons is also an important one. There are over 40 weapons to choose from, and each one is designed to be competitive with the others, providing its own set of strengths and weaknesses, as well as a unique ability that sets it apart from its peers.
Characters can also utilize supernatural abilities to aid them in combat:
 The Touch allows characters to manifest their imagination as reality, until proven to be nothing more than a fantasy of the mind.
 Blessed Beasts are creatures manifested from the user's own soul, and can protect them or attack their foes.
 Wretched Weapons are murder tools summoned through contracts and deals struck with otherworldly entities. Those who wield them can cause great mayhem and destruction.
Firstly, we're delivering the completed ruleset and setting of Crescent. All of this is digitally supported, and will be accessible on an easy to use website which will serve as a database for all information pertaining to the game.
While some content to the game will only be accessible to those who have a website key obtained by pledging to the Kickstarter or purchasable after release, much of the basic and starter content will be free to all users on the website.
Free Content:
Rules on how to play the game
A starter kit of several premade characters, and instructions on creating characters
Hundreds of Techniques for Level 1 - 2 characters
Statistics and descriptions for Level 1 - 2 enemies
An in-depth and extensive homebrewing guide for GMs to create within the setting
Guidelines on how to build and run campaigns in the Crescent
Details on the overall world of the Crescent and its inhabitants
Multiple one-shot adventures for easy drop-in play and getting your feet wet
A technique database for easy access and sorting
Crescent character sheets in Roll20
Most Free Content for the game has already been started and is accessible right now. While it will be finished, polished, and better displayed if the Kickstarter is successful, you can view it right now at the following places:
Crescent Rules, Starter Kit, One-Shots:  Crescent Rules Document 
Technique Database Preview:  Technique Database 
Roll20 Crescent Character Sheet: Available as an optional character sheet on Roll20
Sample database hosted on our promotional website
With Website Key:
A character sheet page which can be updated and saved with your character's information
A Game Master page which can store notes and information about your campaigns
Thousands of Techniques for Level 3 - 10 Characters
Statistics and descriptions for Level 3 - 10 Enemies
A fully developed region of the Crescent, called the Volcanic Region, complete with descriptions of 20+ islands, important factions and people, and unique threats
80+ detailed islands with unique magic, environments, creatures, and peoples, and tables for generating islands easily
A starter adventure set on the island of Graceland that can act as a self contained story, or spread into a larger campaign if the players leave the island (see Graceland and the "War in Graceland" adventure summary here) 
An animated Die Roller
We're taking our project to Kickstarter to be able to provide a game that is much more accessible (through our website and database) and immersive (with high quality art and other assets) than we could create without the resources that the funding from KS provides.
 If we’re funded, in addition to the completed game with thousands of Techniques, we’ll be able to provide a fully digital compendium of all of the game’s rules, as well as character sheets and easy ways to track and store your information. While we possess the coding experience needed to make our vision a reality, the breadth of the project demands that we find additional support to deliver a complete and satisfactory product.

Want to learn more?
Crescent Actual Play on Roll20:
Website: https://crescentrpg.com/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/rpg_crescent
Discord: https://discord.gg/gMvqUrksGh
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Though our team has been playing TTRPGs and creating homebrew content for them for years, this is the first big project that we’ve worked on. As such, we’ve been taking notes and inspiration from many other TTRPGs in development and Kickstarter projects. Fortunately and unfortunately, there’s too much content in Crescent for it to translate well into the standard book format that many other TTRPGs use, which does allow us to sidestep the potential difficulties that come with printing and distributing our content. 

The transition to a web-based format also works well for our team’s skillset, as one of our two members is an experienced web developer, and the other has experience in writing and editing. Even with a game with the degree of depth that Crescent has, we’re confident that we can deliver its content in an easy to learn and browse format. If you want to take a first look at our promotional page, you can view it here: https://crescentrpg.com/. 

The game itself is also well into its development cycle. We’ve created most of the underlying systems and mechanics that will be present in the finalized version, and have finished all content for the first two levels of character creation. That said, creating content for the next eight levels will take some time. We’ve dedicated some of the funds we gain from this Kickstarter to ensure that we have the time to create a full experience for players through all ten levels.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The Kickstarter's End and Going Forward
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,  
First and foremost, we want to extend a huge thank you to everyone who has supported Crescent. Unfortunately we weren’t able to meet our funding goal during our Kickstarter campaign, but this doesn’t mean the end of Crescent! We’re going to continue working on the game, and return to Kickstarter when we’ve got more to show to them, with new art, better virtual tools, a physical rulebook, and additional systems and higher levels which we were going to work on regardless of whether our Kickstarter succeeded or not. Most importantly, when we return we’ll have much less to ask of backers, with a significantly reduced funding goal.

Over the last week, we've had a few awesome opportunities to talk with members of the Tabletop RPG community. We talked with Dan Davenport over at Randomworlds in a Q&A style format. You can check it out here if you're interested in learning more about Crescent and its design team.
We also talked with Mildra the Monk over on Youtube. He's a very charming guy and we had a great conversation around the systems and inspirations for Crescent that you can find here.

Hello everyone!
Thank you everyone who pledged to our game! As we're entering our fourth day, we're well on the way to having our project meet its goal. Crescent is a very important project to us, and we're happy to see it getting praise and attention.
We're working on create part two of our actual play now, which we're expecting to have up on youtube by Monday. As usual, we recommend that you check out our Discord server where we post all of our videos, artwork, and game updates. You can join here: !

updates.update_userinfo: Thanks you for all the support!
updates.update_content:
Our kickstarter has just launched! For anyone checking out the project, feel free to send us any questions at crescentttrpg@gmail.com or join our discord to contact us there. We'll also be regularly giving project updates here. We're looking forward to a fun campaign!
-Logan

campaign.story:
The Prophecy of Nine Omens Trilogy contains three classic fantasy adventures for the fifth edition of the world’s largest roleplaying game.

You’ll get a book with the following adventures and compendium:
➛ No Honour Among Thieves
➛ Sea Monsters ahead, Captain!
➛ The Sunken Temple of Sirenholm
➛ The Brave Adventurer’s Guide with all unlocked stretch goals
➛ Bonus: You’ll get a special mention in the book!

We’ll also include free VTT tokens, gridless maps, and digital handouts so that the adventures can easily be played online.   
This project is FULLY FUNDED thanks to our amazing backers and ALL STRETCH GOALS HAVE BEEN UNLOCKED! THANK YOU!!! :)    
The Prophecy of Nine Omens Trilogy will be approximately 160 pages if all stretch goals are unlocked, and available in hardcover, softcover, and digital format.
The adventures are designed for characters of level 10 to 12, but includes scalable encounters to suit any level from 1 to 20.

The Brave Adventurer’s Guide will contain new monsters, magical items, spells, and more. It will also feature unlocked stretch goals and be available to all backers.

This book is created by Midnight Tower, the two nerds who brought you Rise of the Ice Dragons Trilogy, What happened to Evy Ashwood? and Before the Stroke of Midnight.

Join us on our epic journey!
All aboard!         
The Prophecy of Nine Omens has foretold that three legendary orbstones will cause death and destruction throughout Eastern Farraway.
The orbstones must be destroyed to avert the prophecy and stop the cataclysm.

You have to cunningly steal the orbs from a heavily protected vault and transport them across the sea to the secret location of the sunken city of Sirenholm. Only there, in the heart of the underwater Temple of Tanaaris, can the orbstones be obliterated.

Gather your companions. Bring your swords. Choose your spells wisely.
Are you ready to save Eastern Farraway?  
➛ Three classic adventures with exciting quests and magical treasures!
➛ Approximately 160 pages of content (if all stretch goals are unlocked)
➛ New monsters: Arcane Sentinel, Marauder, and Horrifying Jellyfish
➛ Plenty of illustrated and detailed NPCs with personal background descriptions, including traits, ideals, bonds, and flaws.
➛ Unique magical items such as The Emerald Crown, Njǫrd’s Bow, and Gift of Malgonath.
➛ More than 90 full-colour illustrations and original artworks, including professional commissions from Alaina Milare (Empyrean Investigations and Rise of the Ice Dragons Trilogy)
➛ Legend & Lore: The Prophecy of Nine Omens, the White Watchers, and the Temple of Tanaaris
➛ High-quality maps created by cartographers such as Dark Realm Maps and Lizard Ink Maps
➛ The Brave Adventurer’s Guide featuring all unlocked stretch goals and more
➛ VTT pack with tokens, gridless maps, and digital handouts for online gaming
➛ Bonus: Your name will be featured in the book! (Immortality and endless fame unlocked!)        
The book will be filled with NPCs that the players can interact with. Several NPCs will be illustrated by Alaina Milare, the artist behind the NPC portraits in Before the Stroke of Midnight and other books by Midnight Tower.
➛ You’ll get the book before it’s released anywhere else
➛ You save money, as all prices are heavily discounted
➛ You’ll be part of the community and get to be involved in shaping the book by voting for stretch goals, joining contests, and getting sneak peeks of the project as it comes alive      
You get to watch the book come alive and be part of shaping the content.
This is our fifth Kickstarter campaign and thanks to our amazing backers all of our previous projects have been successful.

We’re really excited to share this new project with you, and we’ve been working hard day and night to create the book. The adventures have been playtested together with a gaming group, and we had a lot of fun during the sessions, so we can’t wait to share these adventures with you!

We now kindly ask for funding to cover production costs to make this book truly epic!
The production costs include commissioned maps ($1,100), beautiful illustrations ($330), covers ($250), print design and artwork ($500), and professional proofreading ($150).

The more funding we get, the better the adventures and the compendium will be, and the more art commissions we’ll be able to afford – which in turn will support other fantasy artists! :)   
The book will include several hand-drawn and watercolour maps by Toby Lancaster from Dark Realm Maps, for example the strange Temple of Tanaaris.
The book will contain plenty of unique magical items, for example The Emerald Crown, Njǫrd’s Bow, and Gift of Malgonath.
We’ll also include free VTT pack with tokens, gridless maps, and digital handouts so that the adventures can easily be played online.
The digital pack includes +30 VTT tokens, 10 gridless maps, and over 15 handouts including NPC portraits, monsters and magical items. Great for online gaming!    
An example of some of the VTT tokens that will be included in the digital virtual tabletop pack. In total over 30 tokens will be added to the adventures.
All maps come in four different versions: Gridless (perfect for online gaming), square grid, hexagon grid, and printer-friendly black and white versions. Some of the maps will also be available for the DM (with numbers, secret doors, and traps) and for Players without additional information.
We love local game shops and offer greatly discounted prices to retailers with a brick-and-mortar store. Midnight Tower’s roleplaying books are available at The Gaming Goat (US), The Shop on the Borderlands (UK), Science Fiction Bokhandeln (Sweden), Dillbergs (Sweden), DoDragaoGaming (US), 3 Trolls Games & Puzzles (US), The Jousting Yeti (US), and others.

We offer a heavily discounted price if you order five or more copies of the book.
You also get the option to order previously released titles by Midnight Tower. This pledge is for retailers with a brick-and-mortar shop. You must have a physical location where you sell books or roleplaying games.

Erik is a bookish nerd (level 6, chaotic good). He does much of the graphic design and edits the adventures for Midnight Tower.

Tove and Erik live in Oxford (UK) together with their rebellious daughters and a small menagerie of pets, including two sarcastic cats, a tiny pseudodragon (leopard gecko), and a springer spaniel with a lazy eye.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is Midnight Tower’s fifth Kickstarter campaign, and all of our previous campaigns have been successful thanks to our amazing backers!!!
The adventures have already been written and playtested. We’re collaborating with DriveThruRPG for the printed versions of the book. We’ve partnered with them before and are really happy with the results – the books look great! 

We’ve learned to always add extra time to our schedule, and so far all of our Kickstarter projects have been fully delivered. Having said that, sometimes there have been a few delays due to unforeseen circumstances. (For example: An untimely broken wrist, the coronavirus pandemic, Brexit, a freakish snowstorm in Spain…we have seen and weathered it all.)

If we don’t reach the goal for this Kickstarter, all backers will get their money back. We’ll probably struggle to pay artists and editors with our own money. (This is not a sob story. We’ll be fine and can still feed our rebellious kids and various pets.) 

However, if all the excellent and awesome people out there support our campaign and we reach our goal, we can make the book and the adventures even better, with more content and commissioned fantasy artwork! 

Thank you for considering backing Midnight Tower’s Epic Kickstarter Campaign! :)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Cover by Bret Rood
Logo by Bret Rood
by Dean Spencer
by Eric Kemphfer
by Dean Spencer
by Stan Morrison
by Dean Spencer
by Pete Bradley
by Dean Spencer
After more than 40 years of playing and running tabletop RPG's, I am finally realizing a life-long dream of designing my own game! Blood, Sweat & Steel is a Sword & Sorcery/Dark Fantasy tabletop RPG that is built on the Fudge game engine, with some Fate influences as well. This game takes place in what can best be described as a human-centered, barbaric world, largely unexplored, and filled with dark sorcery, strange beasts, and undiscovered ancient secrets. The world is largely uncivilized, and resembles the worlds of Conan the Barbarian, Kull the Conqueror, Dar from The Beastmaster, and Deathstalker, from the movie "Deathstalker".
My primary goal is to create a sword & sorcery/dark fantasy RPG that is easy to learn, easy to run, and has the quickest resolution possible in order to keep the game moving at an exciting pace. I want to make a game that introduces non-gamers and new gamers to the sword & sorcery and dark fantasy genres.
The most unique features of the game include:
 Unified Dice Mechanic - every roll in the game uses the same Fudge/Fate dice roll
 Skill-Based Characters - no classes or professions. PC's generally consist of Attributes, Skills, Qualities, and Talents.
 Simultaneous Actions Resolution - no initiative rolls. Everything happens simultaneously, with the winners of each Exchange taking their action against the losers of each Exchange.
 No Weapon/Armor Stats Or Damage Rolls - Resolution determined from a single opposed roll
 Non-Linear Wound System - no hitpoints or wound track, uses a threshold system
 Freeform Sorcery System - no spell or ritual lists, Characters create whatever spells and rituals they can think of
 Goal-Based Character Development - Characters earn experience points by accomplishing specific Major and Supporting Goals.
 Abstract Economic System - no more accounting and bookkeeping to account for every copper piece.
 Situational Modifiers - Modifiers are designed to be used where they make sense, allowing GM's and groups to have more flexibility in resolving conflicts.
 Robust Combat Tactics - From zone-based movement, to combat stances, to combat maneuvers (like tripping, disarming, tackling, etc.), Players can employ advanced tactics and strategies to tip the scales to their favor.

updates.update_content:
Well, we are on our way to $6k! It has been an incredible journey to this point, and we can't wait for the next phase! Proofing is just about completed, so we're still a little ahead of schedule so far! We're hoping to send the core rules off to the printer in the next 1-2 weeks! "Curse of the Black Hand" will be ready for distribution at the end of the Kickstarter, and every backer will be receiving it for free. "Horror from the Void" should be ready to send out in the next 3-4 weeks!
The Bestiary is coming along nicely, and we believe that this will be the most comprehensive bestiary every created for a Fudge-based RPG!

Wow, what a ride it has been! First, thank all of you again for your support and giving me a chance to create what I believe to be a truly unique game that really captures the sword & sorcery genre. The core text was completed a few weeks early, so we are just doing final proofreading before sending it off to the printers for proofing. 
With regards to the 2 adventure modules, "Curse of the Black Hand" is almost completed, and we're hoping that will be available in the next 2-4 weeks. "Horror from the Void" is still being converted from outline form to final form, and that one should be completed in 4-6 weeks. Keep in mind that both of these adventures will be included with every single pledge, free of charge.

updates.update_userinfo: You did it!! THANK YOU SO MUCH!! $5k Reached!!
updates.update_content:
We just hit our 2nd stretch goal of $5,000! And to celebrate, we'll be including the adventure module, "Horror from the Void" as a digital PDF! You will now be able to grab your copy of "Horror from the Void"!
We were originally going to offier it as a $1 add-on, but we want to show our appreciation to everyone who has shown their support and offer it absolutely free to all backers! This adventure module has only begun to be written, but it will hopefully be available shortly after the Kickstarter ends, and will be emailed out separately. Please be sure to include your email address in the backer surveys, as you will be receiving two adventure modules; "Curse of the Black Hand", and "Horror from the Void".

Hello everyone! We wanted to let everyone who is thinking about joining our Patreon know that we will be adding regular livestreams to discuss various elements of the game; such as character creation,GM preparation, handling complex combat scenes, how the sorcery system works, how to create useful and fun Qualities, and many more topics! There is already content available as we got Patreons more quickly than we expected and wanted to make content available right away.
The livestreams will be monthly to start, until this Kickstarter campaign is all wrapped up, and then we'll be doing livestreams twice per month, eventually going weekly. Livestreams will generally run 60-90 minutes, and anyone who watches live will be able to ask questions during the livestream.

updates.update_userinfo: Regular Livestreams added to our Patreon Page!
updates.update_content: We are plugging away and things are still just a little ahead of schedule, so we're trying to stay on track! To that end, Bret has some more images completed, so I wanted to show a few of them here!

Well, we were going to wait a month to start putting out content for our Patreon, but we already have subscribers, so we're stoking the fires and kicking up our pace to start adding content right away!
If you are thinking about joining our Patreon, but were waiting for the end of the Kickstarter, feel free to sign up now as we are putting out content immediately. There will be weekly characters, weekly villains, monthly creature features, character backstories, short story fiction, and monthly adventure modules just for starters! We've already started putting content in our Patreon library, and will be adding more content this week!

updates.update_userinfo: Fudgit! Publishing Patreon is live and generating content!
updates.update_content:
Hey there, James here! I just want to say that I continue to be overwhelmed by the amazing response to our little campaign so far! I'm so very grateful to everyone who has thrown their support behind my lifelong dream! I only hope that I might get a chance to actually play some BS&S with some of you some day!

As we get closer and closer to our next stretch goals, we're also trying to come up with some novel add-on ideas to keep the fun going all the way through to the end of the campaign! Stay tuned!
