campaign.story:
Introduction
Something is rotten in the town of Darwich. A mysterious creature has moved into the cemetery and murders anyone who dares enter its new hunting grounds. Eyewitness reports say the monster looks like some sort of golem crafted from tombstones and mossy grave markers. A party of confident adventurers have been hired to rid the town of this dangerous pest, a task that should be wrapped up by the afternoon, with a heavy pouch of gold awaiting its completion. Yet, could this be merely a harbinger of greater evils that infest the land? What darksome power might be lurking that threatens the whole of the Northern Kingdoms?
In the blackness of night, the laughter of the dead makes cowards of us all.
The Adventure
Dawn of the Necromancer is a 5th edition DnD campaign that pits your PCs against a necromancer of unimaginable power. Here’s what you can expect to find…
 Epic Scope: Players begin at 1st level and advance all the way to 20th before the final showdown.
 Adaptable: Easily drops into your own campaign setting, or use the included high fantasy setting of Argomere, a medieval European-style world that worships the gods of the Greek pantheon.
 Sprawling: A sandbox-style adventure with the players traveling between a cosmopolitan city, memorable towns, an ancient necropolis, and other dark destinations.
 Imaginative: Includes something for everyone…amazing new magic items, nightmarish monsters, challenging puzzles, detailed locations, unique NPCs, and most importantly, encounters unlike any you have ever seen!
 Flexible: Each of the 40 major encounters and countless additional adventure hooks can be easily lifted out and used as one-shots or to supplement your current campaign.
 Customizable: All the encounters include advice on how to adjust the difficulty based on the level and abilities of the PCs. A sandbox isn’t fun if everything is under- or overpowered.
 Format: Available in both digital form and a 250-page hardcover book.
Sample Excerpts
Here are some snippets from the adventure to give you a feel for the content:
In Ashgate capital punishment is carried out by the Royal Torpeo, a medusa who petrifies the convicted and then oversees their body being smashed to pieces by those who were wronged as they wield the ceremonial Hammer of Justice.
The PCs hear about an annual celebration in the Rookeries called “The Running of the Gorgons”. Each gorgon has a wreath of solid gold secured to their head that runners can keep if they can snatch it off. The use of magic is prohibited, but difficult to enforce with crafty PCs. Harming the gorgons is prohibited, and festival organizers do not provide resurrection services for the participants, a fact made evident by the “Hall of Runners” that displays all the petrified former participants.
 Cobb’s Boots (Wondrous Item, uncommon) While wearing these boots you can flee from danger in a speedy manner known derisively as “Cobb’s Traverse.” When moving away from an attacking opponent your speed is doubled (regardless of armor or encumbrance) and you can jump twice the normal distance if it is not further than your movement would allow. When attempting a saving throw against a fear effect you suffer a -2 penalty.
Constable Marret quote: “I’m glad the council took my advice and brought in some professional help to deal with the situation in the cemetery. I’d take care of it meself if they gave me some deputies and whatnot. And if it weren’t for this bum leg. Or the dropsy. But no matter…as they say, in Darwich justice always prevails!” (The constable is literally the only person who says this.)
 Half-Swording Feat: This feat requires the wielder of a longsword or greatsword to have both hands free. By grasping the blade of the weapon with their free hand the wielder gains the following benefits: 1.) Change the damage type to piercing or bludgeoning. 2.) Gain a +2 bonus on all Shove attacks. 3.) If their opponent is wearing medium or heavy armor, spend a bonus action to exploit weak spots and gain a +2 to hit.
 Favored by the Gods optional rule: Praying at a temple, church, or shrine gives the petitioner Advantage on their next attack or ability check connected to that deity (Ares or Athena for combat, Hercules for a Strength check, and so forth.). Alternatively, the GM might allow the PC to choose when to use this Advantage die.
“The Jewel of the North”, Dorias is a powerful kingdom dominated by its magnificent namesake capital city. This ancient, ruin-filled city was also once the capital of the Therosian Empire. The waterfront of the city was prized by the old nobility who began to build out into the Gulf of Adsko, eventually expanding the footprint of the city by over 50% and creating an elaborate system of canals and bridges. Dorians are famed sailors and control many of the waterways in the north. Their merchants range far and wide, making the capital a major trade center. At one time Dorias was home to the mighty Therosian fleets of skyships, but the entire navy was in the air when Hecate’s Storm at the end of the War of Brothers dropped them out of the sky and dashed them all to pieces. Even today, artificers attempt to recapture the lost secrets of the skyships in hopes of creating unimaginable trade possibilities.
The Playtest
The crazier the encounter, the more important a comprehensive playtest becomes. Dawn of the Necromancer was in playtest over a year to make sure we got the balance just right. Here’s what the playtesters had to say about the adventure:
"This campaign is so fun and rewarding because every journey has a pay-off and every action has consequences. Nothing we do is forgotten; everything we do ripples throughout the campaign world. The story is compelling, the lore is very well developed, and the characters are all extremely unique. It's a blast!" -Josh F.
“Dawn of the Necromancer is as unique as it is fun! I've never experienced an adventure like this. And it's so refreshing to not have the main villain come out of a box like the typical ‘bad guys’.” -Scott R.
“Very creative content across the board... world, maps, creatures, antagonists, protagonists, traps, and magic items. Tons of fun.” -Justin F.
"As a long-time D&D player (since I was but a lad), I am impressed by the insightful story and fun twists on encounters, each having an aspect that makes them memorable and challenging." -Mike N.
“The Necromancer is a sexy redhead that will let not rest until she has captured the hearts of the heroes, literally. Loved it!” -Doug S.
“This is hands down the best campaign I ever played. Love the encounters, love the mysteries, love the world. The hanging chasm fight was an all-time favorite. Can’t wait to read the book and see all the stuff we screwed up.” -Trevor G.
Why Kickstarter?
Dawn of the Necromancer is already written, and several groups spent the last year playtesting all the way through. So, why release through Kickstarter?
It’s simple, an adventure this ambitious requires an enormous number of illustrations, maps, and graphics. We could release the book today as-is, but we want it to look as good as it plays. That means adding a lot more artwork!
The book is being laid out right now and we will begin commissioning additional artwork as soon as we reach our initial funding goal. We plan to send out the digital copies of the book as soon as it is done (likely mid-summer 2021) and have the hardcover versions available by the end of summer 2021.
The hardcover version of the book will be produced by the industry-leading DriveThruRPG Print-On-Demand service, the same service used by Dungeon Master's Guild. The book is expected to clock in at almost 250 pages once complete and will be available in standard hardcover (with "standard" color), premium hardcover (with "premium" color), or a limited-edition Collector's Edition (also with "premium color").
Now it’s Your Turn to Face the Necromancer
Go ahead and pledge. We know you’re going to love it. But you don’t have to take our word for it. We’ve included a sample encounter for you to download and play right now to get a feel for what to expect.
We’ve also got some stretch goals planned, so please share this project with your friends so we can ensure the absolute best adventure possible.
Buckle up and let’s roll for initiative!
Virtual Battle Maps Unlocked!
All of our stretch goals have now been unlocked. After reaching our social media sharing stretch goal we added DIGITAL BATTLE MAPS of every major encounter to every pledge level.
New Monster Pictures Unlocked!
We already had some creature illustrations, but upon hitting our $20,000 stretch goal we added pictures of all new monsters in the adventure. Flavor text can conjure a compelling scene but like they say, a single picture is worth a thousand-word stat block.
New Subclasses Unlocked!
The most frequent request we have received since launching this project is to include new campaign-specific subclasses. Upon hitting $26,000 we subsequently added three new subclasses to the book.
There is a ranger archetype that hunts the most dangerous of prey…that which is already dead. These sworn enemies of the undead are known as Death Hunters. Whether prowling old graveyards alone or patrolling ancient necropoli in small teams, the death hunters have the abilities and training to make short work of any undead they encounter, from lowly skeletons to mighty vampire lords.
Every druid understands the natural cycle of life and death that governs the breadth of existence. The all-consuming undead are an existential threat to this balance and it is the druids of the Circle of Life who seek to restore order to the world around them. Druids of this circle can compel nature itself to rise up against the undying scourge.
Last, but certainly not least, we meet the Necroficer subclass for wizards. A cross between a necromancer and artificer, necroficers don’t create better undead, they slowly transform themselves into powerful undead…one body part at a time. This isn’t simply combining Dr. Frankenstein with his monster, these spellcasters use necromantic body horror to gain supernatural powers. Learn exactly how dangerous that makes them, inside the pages of Dawn of the Necromancer.
Picture the NPCs
Dawn of the Necromancer features dozens of major NPCs, and thanks to reaching our $35,000 stretch goal, we're going to have portraits of ALL of them. Let's meet one right now: Indara Blackfin, a resident of Highport who figured out a way to be where the people are, with the help of a custom magic item.
Magic Item Pictures
Reaching $45,000 allowed us to unlock artwork of all the new  magic items in the campaign. From powerful artifacts to relatively  mundane objects, many of the magic items exact some sort of  price from their owners.
One example of a magical item found in Dawn of the Necromancer is the Hat of Whimsy. A jester’s hat that borrows inspiration from the Wand of Wonder,  activating the hat randomly confers temporary, yet powerful  enchantments upon its wearer ranging from transformation into a demigod,  toddler, flying monkey, or even stranger effects. Does the potential  reward outweigh the risks?
Another magic item that might be encountered is the Golem Hammer. Just what in Zeus’ name does a Golem Hammer do exactly? It might not be what you expect!
VTT Tokens & Player Handouts
Now that we hit $51,000 we will create Virtual Tabletop tokens for all of the new monsters and major NPCs in the campaign. These images will be added to the same zipped folder as the virtual battle maps.
In addition, all backers will also receive digital copies of all of the player handouts and assets they need to GM the campaign: isolated pictures of the NPCs, monsters, magic items, locations, maps, et al. No more holding up the book and trying to hide stat blocks while showing what a monster looks like. We want to provide you with every imaginable piece of information and digital art to make your adventure prep as simple as possible.
Share the Adventure
Remember, there’s one sure way to unlock this stretch goal and a bunch of other cool ones we have planned…share the project! The fate of Argomere is in your hands.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
- The book is already written, so there are few risks to you receiving exactly what you pledge for.

- Keep in mind that all the artwork used in this Kickstarter campaign and the current version of the book (even the cover art) is preliminary and may change/improve depending on the final funding and stretch goals. 

- Once the book is finalized we will send backers a link to the digital version (hosted by DriveThruRPG) immediately. We will simultaneously submit the hardcover versions to the printer, but it will likely take a month for the printer to run the book through their pre-media checks and print proof copies. Once everything checks out we will order the physical hardcover books. After the order is placed it is estimated to take approximately three weeks before it arrives on your doorstep (for domestic orders).

- Without knowing the final page count, or what changes will occur with postage rates, we are using the best estimates of shipping/handling costs supplied by the printer. Our apologies in advance if there are any inaccuracies in the final cost.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Final Stretch Goals Unlocked
Thank you so much for your faith in our project. We’ve passed our final stretch goals and have unlocked Virtual Tabletop tokens for all the new monsters and major NPCs in the campaign. We literally couldn’t have done it without you.
What’s Next?
This will likely be our last update while the project is live. At the conclusion of the project you should get an automated email stating that the Kickstarter has successfully funded. After that, Kickstarter collects pledges and tries to resolve any failed payment transactions. This takes two whole weeks for them to sort out before they look at releasing funds for us to finish the book. During that time we will be tightening up the book while looking at final printing and shipping options. There is a decent chance, based on the success of this campaign, that we will do an offset print run for the hardcovers. In this scenario we would still fulfill the digital rewards via DriveThrueRPG but handle the physical rewards ourselves. We will let you know once we know for sure.

updates.update_userinfo: Magic Item Pictures and a Final Stretch Goal
updates.update_content:
Magic Item Stretch Goal
$45,000 and another stretch goal goes down. We’ve already started ordering new artwork for all the major new magic items. We are now in the last few days of the Kickstarter and excited about the fantastic artwork pouring in. The final book is going to be packed with just a ton of new art. Here's a picture of the magical Cobb's Boots mentioned in the project summary:

Collector's Edition Sold Out
Wow! When we kicked off this project, we did not anticipate getting pledges for 300 copies of our Collector’s Edition hardcover. This is just beyond exciting. Thanks to everyone who pledged!
If you missed out on the Collector's Edition, the good news is that aside from different cover art, the interior contents of every version of the book is identical and the stretch goals apply to all of them.

NPC Pictures Unlocked
The project just hit $35,000 and with that another stretch goal is unlocked – portraits of every major NPC in the adventure. Now you can rely on more than your descriptions and voice acting to portray NPCs to the players. That leaves only one final category of pictures for us to add to the adventure…

updates.update_userinfo: Updated Cover Art and a Review
updates.update_content:
Cover Art Update
As we previously mentioned in the Kickstarter, the art inside and outside the book will improve as the project evolves. With a page count close to 250 pages, we expect to have a similar number of graphics (artwork, maps, diagrams, icons, et al.). Our rough layout right now has some nice stock illustrations that we continue to replace with custom artwork as our funding level increases. Your pledge allows us to make all these improvements.

updates.update_userinfo: New Subclasses and a New Stretch Goal
updates.update_content:
New Subclasses Added
Wow! Based on how quickly you guys blew past our latest stretch goal it’s evident you want some zombie-busting subclasses. We are working on them now and will need to do some playtesting to make sure they are balanced, but they are now part of the campaign.

The $20,000 stretch goal was just unlocked and—BOOM—we’ll be adding illustrations of every new monster in the adventure. In anticipation of hitting the goal we might have cheated and pre-ordered a few. Meet the latest addition to the book…(NAME REDACTED).

Virtual Battle Maps for Everybody!
Thank you to everyone who participated in our social media sharing stretch goal. A special thanks goes to Hollywood screenwriter Craig Mazin (write of HBO’s Chernobyl, The Last of Us) who discussed his excitement for Dawn of the Necromancer on the popular Scriptnotes podcast (episode #499). As a result of everyone’s efforts we have unlocked the battle maps.

A New Hardcover
The Dawn of the Necromancer Collector’s Edition hardcovers are capped at 300 copies and will only be available during this Kickstarter. At our current velocity we will likely run out of the Collector’s Edition hardcovers in a few weeks. In anticipation of this happening, we are adding a new pledge level…premium hardcovers.

campaign.story:
Tangent Space is a sci-fi tabletop roleplaying game that seeks to capture the grand scope and optimism of classic space operas. Featuring diverse alien societies, advanced technology, epic space battles, and a future worth fighting for.
Tangent Space is set within a nascent utopia where the various alien nations of the galaxy try to come together despite their differences. The year 3025 is a great time to live! The core worlds are peaceful and nobody is poor or homeless. The frontier is dangerous and unknown, begging for exploration and adventure. Grand and powerful factions compete for influence on the ever shifting galactic stage. Mysterious precursors have left treasures and warnings for those they deem worthy successors. The universe of Tangent Space is as limitless as our own galaxy!
Tangent Space was designed to be easy to pick up and play, but also provide increasing complexity as you delve deeper into the possibilities. The rules were crafted with science fiction TV shows and movies in mind. Everything takes places within a scene, which is as long a time period as makes dramatic sense. It could be a single combat encounter, or several days traveling through space. The game moves at the speed of plot.
Tangent Space is played using a custom dice-scaling system. Dice get bigger when things are easier, and dice get smaller when things are difficult. Your chances of success shift as circumstances change from one turn to the next. Moments play out as exchanges of actions and reactions rolling against one another. Teamwork is actively encouraged within the mechanics as allies set each other up for success.
Ten playable species are available. Each comes with four different cultural backgrounds that describe their civilization and offer unique advantages. Species and culture are separate, offering a wide variety of interesting combinations to choose from when making your character.
There are no classes and no character levels. Instead, it's the 40 skills that gain levels as characters progress in the four skill categories: Martial, Technical, Social, and Psionic. Archetypes are provided as suggestions to help new players get started.
Equipment is modular, with a flexible crafting and invention system that lets you customize your kit even further. This modular design extends to vehicles and spacecraft,  which use a modified version of the character rules.
Download the demo version from itch.io here:
Tangent Space RPG - Demo Version
Tangent Space has been a passion project of mine for my entire adult life. It's grown and developed in ways that actually surprised me, but it's in a place now where I truly believe it's "Good." The mechanics are complete and, aside from balancing tweaks from testing, won't be changing much going forward. What I don't have is all the professional trappings to make the game come to life: Art, editing, and publishing. All these things are very expensive and make the difference between a game that stands out and one that gets swept aside. I'm hoping that through this Kickstarter, you'll be able to hold a finished copy of Tangent Space in your hands and have memorable adventures in this universe.
The game book will be completed in two versions: digital and print.
The digital version will be an interactive PDF with bookmarks and hyperlinks for quick navigation. A horizontal layout is planned for easier viewing and it will also be formatted to play nice with screen readers.
The print version will be available through DriveThruRPG print-on-demand services, formatted to standard 8.5 x 11 page size. Backers will receive a voucher for "at cost" printing. This means they will need to pay the printing and shipping costs separately from their pledge. Reward level pricing for the physical tier has been reduced accordingly.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The overall quality of the finished product will depend on how well funded it is. The funding goal is the estimated bare minimum to commission enough art to fill the 400+ pages of the finished book. A picture speaks a thousand words and layout can only do so much to glam up a wall of text. The better this campaign does, the more I can afford to put into the project, such as more detailed artwork for vehicles and alien lifeforms.

The physical books will be fulfilled using DriveThruRPG print-on-demand services. If this campaign does well enough to attract an actual publisher, I'll consider working with them instead. This is my first book publication, so I expect to have to learn as I go!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
PLAY

Gaming Gear to Last a Lifetime
The mission of Big Pockets is a simple one: we want people to have the best gaming mats and tools modern technology can produce. The demands of tabletop gaming mean that such products need to be simple, versatile, super strong, and environmentally friendly. 
Our products are made of extremely durable, non-toxic silicone sheets that are simply superior to vinyl, plastic, neoprene or laminated products currently on the market.
The best wet/dry erase surface you can find.
Always lays perfectly flat, will never crease, yet easily folded up.
Will not blow away in the wind, or get easily shifted on the table.
Drinks, cheese snacks and cats bounce right off it.
Dishwasher safe.
Doubles as a baking sheet for pizza and cookies.

Our Kickstarter
PLAY

Your pledge to this Kickstarter gets you:
One silicone Double-Sided Table Mat (one-inch square and one-inch hex); 33 x 23.5 inch (84 x 60 cm), The same size as an international standard paper A1 sheet.
One Big Pocket Canvas carry bag 17.7 x 17.7 x 5.9 inch (45 x 45 x 15 cm), big enough for all your game gear, zip close, includes an internal zip pocket and shoulder strap.
One silicone Generic Character Sheet
One silicone Combat Tracker Sheet
 All of which are designed to work for any gaming system, for any need.
The design work is done, the production moulds are ready to go. 
Backers also unlock a range of custom options, including a zero-pigment Table mat that can overlay existing battle maps, or provide the perfect surface over an inset display screen that can hold miniatures, receive notes with marker pens, and protect everything under it from metal dice rolls and food spills.
Stretch Goals
If we get enough backers, we can unlock a revolutionary Laptop Gaming Screen which is an excellent practical addition to your modern gaming life. We also have support from DNDWoW who manufacture premium dice sets, including the amazing colour changing mood dice.
Individual Double-sided Table Mat Add Ons
Once you have pledged for one of the Big Pockets Packages, you can add on additional single Double-sided Table Mats to your pledge.
Fun uses for a silicone mapping surface.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The world as we know it is quite different from just a few years ago, restrictions on movement and transport of goods is still a real concern, our hope is delivering direct from manufacturing will reduce any unnecessary complications.

As these are brand new products, we have designed them from scratch and built custom production equipment we are ready to expand depending on demand, but there may be situations such as a supply shortage of silicone which could cause delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
These products are made of silicone rubber, able to withstand oven temperatures, spills, chemicals and the wear and tear of gaming use. We have eliminated any design aspects we think might wear out or tear and made the products super versatile, not just good for RPG games, you can even use the table mat as an oven sheet to bake pizza or cookies.
Reusability and recyclability
A product that never breaks never goes into a landfill. Silicone is non-toxic and will not contribute to ocean plastic waste.
Sustainable materials
Silicone rubber has a minimal environmental footprint, the production does not create toxic byproducts and the material has a very low carbon footprint as well as an exceptional usage lifespan.
Environmentally friendly factories
Consideration for the workers producing the products has been included in the design process, the moulding and printing of sheets are less labour intensive and the products are very impact resistant which reduces the need for packing materials for shipping.
Sustainable Distribution
Shipping direct from manufacturing reduces handling errors and costs, it also increases security for sensitive customer information.
